Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet after extensive research into what would be the best tablet for school, and I am more than satisfied to say the is THE best by miles. Ever played with all variations of iPads and Surfaces and NEXUS tablets, and while some are pretty good, none are as good for note taking. As one reviewer said, if you don't plan on using the S pen this is a waste of money as there are some tablets that are just as good for general uses for a hundred bucks less.The pen is incredible because the text-to-type feature allows even me to read my Own notes, because

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: A. Phillips
Reviews.Content: This is technically the first Note Pad I've owned,  however,  my son won an ipad (the New ipad) a couple of years ago, so I do have experience with that. I definitely did not want an ipad. To me, it's just a glorified smart phone and toy that's not very smart and not much fun to play with. Apple limits the amount of real work and enjoyment one can get out of it.When selecting a note pad, I looked for something that I could be productive with ( particularly with documents and such) whilst having the "oomph" that it takes for some reading and perhaps a movie every now and then. Not everyone who is in business,  thinks business all of the time. Not everyone who enjoys leisurely entertainment,  wants to be entertained all of the time, either.The spen is something I don't think that I'll ever want to give up. I don't know why every pad doesn't have one. I LOVE the spen!This little thing allows me to enjoy movies and reading without a hitch, I can create and edit documents of all types and keep myself more organized than I've ever been.  The quality,  in my opinion,  is great. I like the plastic backing and it has a perfect weight where it doesn't feel cheap or too heavy.All in all, I don't have a bad thing to say, after owning this for a month now. Don't know how I'll feel in a few months, or next year, but right now, this is glued to me and that's where I'm happy to have it!

Reviews.Title: Great for notes
Reviews.Author: David Wehr
Reviews.Content: If you don't have a strong need for an active stylus, this tablet isn't worth the price. On the other hand, if you plan on writing digitally, it's perfect. I use it for all my notes and homework at university. I've never had any complaints about performance or battery life. (In fact, I rarely get it below 50% in a day). The stylus is very accurate. The size seems perfect for a tablet. Much bigger, and I might as well use my laptop, but any smaller and it would be hard to use. It even fits in my coat pocket! All the Samsung junk is a bit annoying, but you can disable most of the things through the Application Manager in settings.Some tips if you want to use it for taking notes:  - I find the app LectureNotes the most capable Android application for note-taking. The full version is $5 I think, but when you just bought a $300 tablet, what's another 5? It easily lets you import PDFs to write on, and you can export as PDF to print to share. By using another application called DropSync, it will sync all your notes to Dropbox (which you get an extra 50GB from buynig this tablet), viewable on your computer.  - I bought a separate stylus to make long writing sessions more comfortable. It's the "Bamboo Stylus Feel for Samsung Galaxy Note". Be sure you get the one with the product code CS300UK2, not CS300UK, because it will not write accurately. It's only available from Wacom's website.

Reviews.Title: yup its awesome
Reviews.Author: M. Cenicola
Reviews.Content: So I have had this for about two weeks and so glad I got the note. I was going to get the 7inch tab but it just wasnt fast enough. I will buy another if ever needed to. Have had other samsung products all have held up very well over time.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for college
Reviews.Author: Daniel Mazzilli
Reviews.Content: I love the Note 8.0, it is great for college. It is the right size, easy to carry and use. The stylus is great, I do a lot of handwriting with it. Would highly recommend it if you are looking for a good college tablet, or for recreational uses.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet

Reviews.Title: Great Tab especially if you get it refurbished. under $300
Reviews.Author: Toineg1
Reviews.Content: I have been purchasing Sam Tabs since the Galaxy Tab 2 7.  Since then I have had the Tab 2 10.1 and the famous and wish they would have kept improving Tab 7.7 which I still have. I also have the Note 2 and a first gen iPad. I wouldn't have even purchased the Note 8 if I had not cracked my screen on the 7.7.  Glad I did purchase it though.  It's faster and showed the age of my 7.7 with how it handles the whole experience of using a tablet.  I won't go thru all the tech stuff that many have submitted.  But I can address the issue of the upgrade to Jellybean 4.2.2.  Samsung must have corrected the problem that many have described where the multi-window functionality stopped working after installing it.  Mine not only worked fine but to my surprise and pleasure, the unit installed all my apps that I had on my 7.7 and afterwards installed the upgrade with no loss of data.  It even restored all my photos that i had on my other units;I purchased the Moko slim case with a magnet.  It may be a little early to tell if it's the magnet or not but every now and then when I fold the flap in back of the tablet hand touches are nonresponsive.  Oddly enough though, the pen still worked.  If I turn it off and back on again the hand touches worked again.  I will use it without the case for a day or 2 to see if that is the problem.  I heard this unit has had problems with magnetized covers.  Otherwise, the experience I have with this tablet is very similar to what I have with the Note 2.  Excellent.  My only gripe is that it didn't come with a better display.  The colors are beautiful and reading text are sharp but the movie experience is no where near as crisp as the Note 2 or even as crisp as my Galaxy 7.7.  Another complaint that i have read is the size of the bezel.  What a silly quibble.  My 7.7 has the exact same size bezel and it was haled as one of the best tablets of its time.  The thing cost $700 without contract when it came out and now we pay 3-400 for a tab that is more powerful and feature rich and complain it cost too much.  i tried using the other tablets with a thinner bezel and my hand kept touching the darn screen activating various apps I didn't want loaded.Plastic is another issue.  Almost all tablets are made of either plastic or aluminum or a combination of the 2.  Look and feel are subjective preferences but to use a tablet without having a protective cover is not very wise imho.Once you place a cover on it, look and feel go out the window anyway.One more quibble.  Battery life.  Not the greatest.  The note 2 lasts all day with heavy use.  I have never been able to max it out even watching movies, surfing, gaming, using the phone etc.  The Note 8 not so much.  You have to put it on power saving mode to get the best life out of it.  I have only had it for 2 days and I already had to charge it once and right now it's at 74%.  Shame on you Samsung.  My Galaxy 7.7 gets better battery life.  But then again it has a super amoled plus display that uses less power with more punch in color and vibrance.  Better blacks too.Even with these caveats, the Note 8 is a great tablet to use and since it is a tablet and not a phone you get true "desktop" web browsing, more screen realestate and Samsung Note apps and usability to boot.  Not bad for $289.  If you want the magazine UI you can download Chameleon Launcher and get the best of both worlds.  Just thought I'd through that in for free.  The launcher needs a little work but it does change the way you see and utilize your tablet.  Better categorizing of home screens etc.Would I recommend the Note 8.0?  Now that you can get at a price point that competes with iPad mini, Nexus 7 and LG G8.3... Yeahhh!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Andrew Tapay
Reviews.Content: I had it narrowed down to this tablet, the Galaxy Note 10.1 (2014), and possibly an iPad (comparable in price to the Note 10.1).I saw this one for $230, factory refurbished. The price was irresistible.I couldn't be happier. I was concerned that the screen was a little to small. I use this mainly for watching videos (often on plane rides) and grading papers (college-level Math homework).I got a (free) Android app for annotating PDF's that I use to grade papers electronically. Having the stylus is indispensable for this purpose, especially because it's very difficult to type Mathematical symbols into any word processor. One can use typesetting software, but this is very impractical when you just want to grade papers.Streaming video over wifi (ESPN3, HBOGO, Netflix) works very well. For plane rides, the Android video player works very well. I have to convert some video files to mp4, but there is viable software on the internet (cost-free) to do this. The battery has been more than sufficient for flying coast-to-coast (unlike my old laptop's battery).I highly recommend the Galaxy Note 8.0. I was a little concerned that the screen would be too small, but I find it to be perfect for my purposes. I like Apple products very much, but I don't think I would be as satisfied with an iPad for its lack of stylus and inflexibility with video playback. (And no, I'm not converting back to Windows or Linux, I still love my MacBook and I'll get another when it dies (6 years and going).)

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: maxine brown
Reviews.Content: I bought it becasue I travel alot and its easy to carry and has  a number of unique features. So far its working great for me

Reviews.Title: Perfect form factor for reading.  Go Samsung!

Reviews.Content: I use this primarily for reading.  It's the perfect screen size.  Adding a leather case made it much easier to hold onto (it's very thin...and finish is smooth plastic, so, you have to be very careful not to drop it).Love the fact that is has a stylus.I bought this as a big brother to my Note 2 phone.  Does everything I need and then some.  I'm a firm believer in Samsung's Note devices.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Stephen T. Eckel "Go Navy"
Reviews.Content: Fast, smooth, and what I hoped for in a smaller portable tablet.  The split screen is excellent.  The stylus is very useful; takes a bit of practice.  Apps noted as optimized for phone work very well on this tablet (just bigger).Easy to set up out of the box, be ready to log in your Samsung and Google accounts.  Will then import in all your Google and Samsung apps and info.One quirk to be prepared to handle - some users, including me, have a problem when the tablet automatically upgrades from android 4.1.2 (out of box) to 4.2.2.  This happens right away.  I soon noticed that the multi screen feature and the quick screen did not work.  Could not fix.  Went to blogs and learned that this is a known problem (thanks Samsung).  The solution is not as scary as it sounds.  Go to settings,backup and select factory reset.  Reinstalls 4.1.2.  Will automatically update to 4.2.2 again, but this time without the error noted above.  Joy, except you now have to set up the tablet all over again.  Any apps and preferences you earlier set have to be redone.  Cost me a half hour or so.Once past that unpleasantness, great experience and great tablet.  Definitely get the Google keyboard as it is superior to the Samsung keyboard; Swype is so fast.The processor is fast! The integration is excellent.  Widgets are excellent.  The Google apps work well together (definitely look into most all of them).  Screen is sharp and as bright as you desire it to be.  Tablet form factor excellent and easy with one hand (OK, I am a male and have a good sized hand).  Battery life good; I charged when I opened it Tue afternoon and all night Tue and still have 27% battery late Thursday night (full disclosure - I only use a bit at breakfast and after work).I would but this tablet again and really like it.  Amazon delivered in two days as promised and charged $30 less than the competition.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing.
Reviews.Author: T. Davis "killerjello"
Reviews.Content: I love drawing on this tablet with the s-pen, I've actually made a full color paid illustration with it. Oh yeah.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Digital Sketchbook
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Edit:  I recently started using Layerpaint HD (a tablet optimized version of Layerpaint with layer modes) and the experience has improved even more.  I can now confidently create finished artwork with it.The Note 8 is an outstanding tablet.  It is very capable for media consumption, such as music, video or even ebooks; all in a neat portable package.  I personally bought it for the previous reasons, but also for the possibility of drawing and painting with the most natural input possible.  Using the Layerpaint app, I have integrated it seamlessly into my workflow*; when the mood strikes I just jot a sketch or two and either finish it right there on the spot, or continue at home with my PC.What advantages does it offer against the competition?1)Wacom technology.  It has 1024 levels of pressure sensitivity, which should make your line work look more natural.  Heck, you can easily calibrate the stylus (and even the app, in some cases) if you dislike the pressure curve or the "cursor" precision!2)The S-Pen has a small tip!  While some people have enough ability to create art with any tool, I am not skilled enough.  Having a smaller contact point with the screen gives me more control and precision, as opposed to using my fingertip or a fat stylus.3)Can handle high resolution, multi-layer files.  With the app I mention above, I have even created 300 DPI and 600 DPI files.  Why is that significant? Because that's print quality, and you can continue whatever you start in the Note 8 with your laptop and be ready for print or web with minor compromises.The one con, and it's a big one, is that currently there are not as many drawing/painting apps as for iOS, but it's a situation that will be resolved over time; Wacom just released an Android based professional tablet that should move things along in that department.  If you look around though, you will find an app or two that will fulfill your needs, and who knows, it could end up becoming an important part of you art routine too.*My current digital only setup is:  Note 8 + Layerpaint HD + Windows 8 Laptop + Wacom Intuos 3 + Manga Studio EX 5.  I do use a standalone Samsung S-Pen which I tweaked to make the pressure sensitivity a bit firmer.Manga Studio 5Manga Studio EX 5Wacom Intuos3 6 x 8-Inch Pen TabletSamsung Galaxy S-Pen Stylus Pen with Eraser for Galaxy Note II

Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for a few days now and enjoy it more and more.  The s note is PERFECT for taking notes at work.  Good bye paper! Reviews.Content: Pros:Great camerasDecent battery lifeS Pen!Cons:The size of the back and menu keys is too large.  When using the tablet in landscape mode my wife and I always hit one of those buttons.Split screen is limited to only a few apps.

Reviews.Title: I'm Content
Reviews.Author: R. L. Robinson "I like stuff."
Reviews.Content: I was looking for tablet upgrade (gave my Motorola Xoom to my father) and this seems to be the right choice. I read reviews about apps not being able to be saved externally but I'm confident that if you look hard enough, you can use an app that will allow your apps to be saved to the micro-sd.I tend to do a great deal of reading and watching movies/tv shows on tablets. I've found the "note taking" feature quite useful at work. Not just for meetings but collecting information from customers & PCs (employed in the IT field). The stylus is very responsive does have the feel of an actual pen or pencil.The size is more than adequate, slides right into my bag's inter-pocket with ease. The resolution isn't the best out there....but those tablets that do rock better screens can't do what this device does plain & simple. I have a Samsung S3 so navigating the OS & interface wasn't an issue at all. It's what I expected from this tablet with due to my experience with my S3.I've already set a calendar reminder on both devices instructing me to download the magnacartaholygrail application. I would recommend this product to individuals who put in a lot of hours with their tablets.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For Me
Reviews.Author: Samm
Reviews.Content: When I was considering a tablet i wanted to find something that had features i could not get on my smartphone or my laptop. This device has those features. Sure, the price tag is a bit high compared to other tablets, especially in this size range, but the stylus and the 8" screen are indispensable for me. I did go out and purchase the "stylus with eraser" for this tablet, because that is just plain cool.

Reviews.Title: The S Pen Stylus is what you're paying for...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: People are comparing this to the iPad mini and the Nexus 7, but there is no comparison, as this comes with the S Pen digitizer stylus. It is a premium price for this feature, but I love the S Pen, I'm sick of capacitive styli, and I was willing to pay for this feature. If you aren't interested in having a digitizer stylus, then there are a host of 7-8 inch class tablets for a lot less money. If you want a tablet with this feature that's less that 10 inches, this is your baby.I don't find the resolution to be a problem with any but the smallest fonts, and the system is powerful enough to be fast and fluid in every way. Other people have covered pros and cons fairly well, so I'll add some other things I noticed:The Note 8.0 uses the same Micro USB cable and 5V 2 Amp charger that came with my Galaxy Note 2. I'm used to the proprietary connection on larger tablets, so this was an unexpected perk.There's a lack of cases out there right now for this size device, but I have a Timbuck 2 sleeve for my old Kindle 2 that fits perfectly. The inside dimensions of the sleeve are 150 mm by 222 mm (5-7/8 inches by 8-3/4 inches), and it fits perfectly. You could probably fit it in a case with the inside dimensions of 140 cm x 212 cm, but you'd need some depth to the case (a sleeve that tight might not fit).Update 1 4/24/2013For reference, I've also owned the Asus TF101, TF201, and TF700 tablets. I currently use a Galaxy Note 2 phone; previously I've used a Galaxy Nexus, Droid 3, and Droid X. My impression of the Note 8 is based on comparisons to the other Android devices I've used.Now that I've had this for several weeks, I absolutely love it. The size is perfect for taking with me to work, it's light and easy to hold for hours. The S Pen takes some practice to learn the commands, but now I can take a screenshot and make notes on it in seconds. The S Note app is the best I've used for handwritten notes, the palm rejection finally makes it so I can use a tablet as a notebook. You can import PDFs or images and make notes on them, and you can export them back out as PDFs or images. I've used the split screen a few times to make notes while I watch a video lecture, that feature is very nice.Battery life is excellent for a tablet. I get about 7-8 hours of screen time use before it hits 25%-30% (my cutoff for plugging it in). Screen use is streaming Netflix, browsing the internet, playing games, etc. Standby uses almost no power. I haven't let it sit unused for more than 8 hours, but the battery drop is minimal. I did set WiFi to turn off when the screen isn't on, this helps out battery life on any Android device.I've turned off the motion detection and eye detection. The eye detection had trouble with my eyes, maybe because I wear glasses?The included IR apps are pretty useless to me. We don't have cable on our TVs- we use streaming services, BluRay, and gaming consoles. I have two Samsung TVs, one from 2009, one from 2010. Neither worked well with the included IR apps. There is an app on the Play market that is compatible with the Note 8 IR blaster (Touchsquid Samsung). At $19 for the home version it's expensive, but then I realized that the Logitech Harmony remote I bought a couple years ago was four times the price and died in 3 months. So, I bought the app, and while it has a huge learning curve, I can control my TVs, DVD, BluRay, Xbox360 and Roku devices with the Note. Very cool.For the control freaks out there, the Note 8 rooted in seconds using Framaroot with the Aragorn exploit. THIS VOIDS THE WARRANTY. Unless you explicitly know why you want to root, don't do it.The entire system is fast and fluid. There's no issue with opening a YouTube link, watching the video the switching back to the browser or app. My poor formerly beloved TF700 Infinity has barely been touched since I got the Note 8, because it had big problems with fluid transitions. Bluetooth connections to external speakers (Jawbone Jambox) and headphones (LG Tone HBS-700) keep the audio in sync with the picture, another problem that my TF700 could never overcome.The Samsung keyboard is AWESOME! I love the swipe input and one-hand mode. Swipe input on tablets can be hit or miss, depending on the keyboard, but the Samsung keyboard in one-hand mode is small enough so swipe inputs can be done quickly. Also, it will automatically open handwriting recognition when the S Pen is pulled out. Previously, Swype was my keyboard of choice, but the Samsung keyboard is the most functional and comprehensive stock keyboard I've ever used.I continue to see reviews comparing this to the iPad Mini and Nexus 7. I stand by my assertion that there simply is NO comparison. Neither has expandable storage, digitizer stylus, or IR blaster. The stylus and IR blaster are not must-have features, but they are 100% worth the price difference. It takes some time to really explore all of the features, but I'm impressed with the functionality of this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: N
Reviews.Content: It is expensive but the 8inch form factor is the perfect spot.  I use this for both work and relaxation.  If you have used wacom pens before and want them then this is the tablet for you.  It was kinda of expensive when I bought it, but because of the wacom pen I expected that.  I personally dont use the pen that much, but I tend to find it easier to write things than type then out on a tablet keyboard. The only downside to this product is that much of the pen support is wrapped up in samsungs software, which makes using custom roms a problem if you stil want pen support.  Samsung is also pretty slow on their updates and their updates arent the best either.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0
Reviews.Author: Gingerbread
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I made this purchase, I have a 10.0 Samsung tablet, which I also love, but this 8 inch is the perfect size to take with you to meetings, work, the grocery store, etc.  The note taking feature is great when attending meetings, no more shuffling papers, no hunting for an ink pen (it's built in)! The resolution screen is beautiful, so clear.  Just the function capability of this tablet makes this a wonderful tool, but it's also and entertainment tablet as well.  If you have any doubts, I would recommend you make the purchase!

Reviews.Title: Love.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my Galaxy Note 8 two months ago and use it constantly.  I am a college student and this tablet has completely replaced my laptop in terms of note taking. There is no longer any reason to carry my heavy computer around campus. The Note 8 is small enough to carry in my bag anywhere I'm going, but big enough to be able to take/see my notes. Perfect for students. I'm very happy I bought this tablet,  100% worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Loving this little tablet
Reviews.Author: SUDS "SS"
Reviews.Content: Have had the Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 for about a month now and I love it. It is my go to tablet. I have an older iPad (2nd Gen) that is still up to  date, but  this Samsung has a lot of advantages over the full sized iPad. First, the Samsung Note 8.0 has an SD slot and I can add additional storage space for a very small cost. Second, the size, this tablet is the size of the iPad mini (I have a full size iPad). The Note 8.0 is much lighter, smaller and it fits in my purse. I can access my work e-mail via the touchdown app (not a huge fan of the app, but it is what my employer requires and it functions), I can easily connect the tablet to a wireless keyboard, and it is easier to read a book on the Samsung Note 8.0 than on a full sized iPad.A second important comparison. My husband bought a Verizon Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 for me as a gift. It was $100 more than the regular Tab 2 because it was compatable with Verizon and this Note 8.0 cost  $100 more than the Verizon Tab 2 and it is not 4G LTE. Within 11 days I maxed out the  Tab 2. The Tab 2 has 1GB of  RAM and this was not enough to support all of the things that I wanted my tablet to be able to do. The guy at Best Buyin the  Samsung department told me that sure I could switch and use my iPhone 5 to access the internet as a hot spot when I was not near Wifi, but that it would  not  be  very fast or as smooth as the Tab 2. I paid the additional $100 and upgraded to the Note 8.0 any way. This was  the best decision!!! This tablet is so much faster than the Tab 2!!! I am so happy that I made the switch!!!In the end, there are some things that I prefer to do on the iPad and based  on the  technology there are some things that just work better  on the Apple iOS than on Android, but  if  had to pick between the ipad or ipad mini and the Galaxy Note 8.0 I would pick the Note 8.0 hands down.I hope this helps you and if you have any questions I will do my best to answer.9/29/13 - the other day I tried to watch an Amazon instant video  only to find that Flash would not work and even though an Amazon video android app exists it will not work on this or other Samsung devices. I was going to drop this by one star but this appears to be an Amazon decision, not a Samsung decision. It appears that the only Android device that will work is the Kindle Fire. Unfortunately Amazon will let this app work on Apple devices just not other Androids. This is frustrating, but ultimately I decided this was an Amazon issue and not an issue with the device. I do wish it would run Flash, but apparently the only tablet that can run flash is the new windows tablet. Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: A Must For The "Write" User
Reviews.Author: Kevin J. Fehr "KFear"
Reviews.Content: First off, I've had the tablet for about 2 weeks now.  I'm coming from an Ipad 2, Asus Prime (with dock), and the Nexus 7.  I prefer Android and the entire Google experience much more than the Apple IOS.The PROS:Samsung brings a lot of features to the table that really work very well.  When the S Pen is unleashed the tablet can open up a world of shortcuts and applications that make wonderful use of the tool.The tablet has a good feed to it.  It doesn't scream out quality like the Asus Prime or Ipad, but doesn't feel cheap.The screen is great, not the best, but no complaints here.  Text is easy to read and crisp enough so that your eyes aren't strained over time.The Samsung Universal apps are actually useful on this tablet.  Not all of them, but i good deal of them are very helpful and functional.SD card storage.  A must in my bookProcessor, with 4 cores, is great for multitasking.Battery life is great.  I have NO idea what people are complaining about when it comes to battery life.  I take notes, surf, play a game or two, and check email.  I can get at least 2 days out of this tablet. I'd guess a good 5-6 hours of video time.  It should make it through that long flight.AirView.  It works very well and it's very helpful, in most cases.SNOTE.  They really did do a wonderful job with this app. My only complain is that landscape mode is too pixelyThe CONS:Even though this is a 1.6 ghz quad core, it can run a little slow when selecting apps and toggles.  I blame Touch Wiz for this, mostly.  If you fully disable the "bloatware" the device becomes a bit faster.  Maybe it's just me?Just comes in white, for now.The Bloatware.  Some of this stuff is just completely unnecessary to put on a device.  "Samsung Cares".  A video demo of the device (for retail).  Samsung, are you kidding me????Reading Mode.  Very cheap trick, doesn't even dim the screen.  Download an app to give yourself more appropriate lighting when in the dark.No ability to change your notification bar toggles.  I LOVE how they made this possible on the S4Settings are hard to find and plentiful.  It will take you a week to find all the little tweaks and features of this beast.  Once you find them all, you'll appreciate the product more and more. Still, the layout isn't the easiest to follow.I hope this brought new info to the table.  It's a great tab, but I have yet to buy a electronic item that is "perfect".  Too me, the Asus Prime came the closest.  BUT...if you need a note taking machine that is a bit more portable than the glitchy 10.1 edition....go for this one.  You won't be disappointed.  If you aren't stuck on Pure Android this is the best smaller tablet on the market.  I sold my Nexus 7 after this purchase.

Reviews.Title: The tablet I was waiting for.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: (Although I had owned two, a kindle fire and a galaxy tab 2 10.,  before.)I really discovered how much one can do on a tablet with the fire, which replaced my 14" dell laptop as my constant companion. But the fire only whetted my appetite for a 'real' android tablet--I.e., one not so buried in the kindle ui, so I bought a galaxy tab 2 10.1. It was very convenient and fast, but not so handy as the fire had been. In fact, I liked the fire so much that I've given three of them as gifts. Meanwhile, I kept being tempted by the note 2, thinking it would be a better all-around device than my tab. I love being able to draw and make notes as well as surf and watch and write. When the ipad mini came out,  I considered it, but it just didn't feel quite right in my hand, and I had become a devoted fan of the android os by then. So, I was hoping Samsung would make a note 7.0, doing all the things I wanted but costing less than the note 2. After all, there's wifi nearly everywhere now.When I heard the next note would be an 8.0" device, I almost went ahead and bought the 10.1 version, thinking the 8.0" size would be nearly as big a hand full, so why not have more real estate to doodle on,especially Iin the duel screen mode.But, the introduction day for the note 8.0 found me at Bestbuy, holding the note 8.0, which is enough different in proportions from the ipad mini to make all the difference. The greater pixel density more than makes up for the 2" smaller screen than the 10.1. And, it's noticeably faster,  at least than the tab 2.After 2 months of daily use,  I am as pleased as I have ever been with any purchase. The battery lasts all day, and it's just a very pleasant little device to carry around. It's hardly heavier than my kindle touch, which seldom leaves the house now . It's surprising easy to see the screen in most light conditions. The keyboard is an easy size to use with one or two hands, and it has the best hand-writing recognition I've yet found, alhough sometimes it decides my capital letters are numerals.The major drawback is that I wish Samsung had immediately introduced it with more memory.Would I recommend it to a friend?  Not necessarily. If you just want to surf the net and watch movies or play games or listen to music, then there are several 7.0 tablets out there at much lower prices. I've been giving the tab 2 7.0's as gifts now that the price is so low, but the nexus is also excellent.But if you want a tablet for creating stuff, the note 8.0 seems the best choice available now.

Reviews.Title: A truly perfect size
Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: ***5/17/13***Update: I just noticed the price drop to $379.99. I contacted Amazon and they gave me a $20 credit from my original price. Amazon comes thru again. Now, with this price, even more of a reason to pick up this tablet.***end update***I have had his item for 2 days now, after orginally trying one on launch, then returning it. I was hoping to see a small price drop after the initial release, but when that didn't happen, I wanted to grab this before the Play credit of $25 went away.So, as I state, this is truly a perfect carry around size for me. I've had no issue with the back button as some people have stated, and the feel of the pen is so close to actual writing that I have almost gone to it all the time for my email and note taking. I put on a Minuguard clear screen protector and find that it gives just the slightest drag on the pen to make it feel like writing on paper.I had been going back and forth between this item and either the Kindle Fire HD or the Nexus. If you want to use the pen, have a rear camera, and card storage, then this item is a no-brainer. If you want something to consume media, then the Kindle Fire HD has the best screen I have ever seen in this size package. The Nexus was the least expensive, was easy to carry also, but I was hooked on the S-pen of the Note and needed a camera for my work.With all that said, the only thing holding me back was the $399 price. But, with the 2 years of 50gig Dropbox, and the $25 Play credit, you can drop that $399 down to $300. Also, this tablet comes with the charger. The Kindle would require another $20 for that part of it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: babydoll
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a tablet to read e books mostly and this do the job. I should have bought the nexus 7 though because it's easier to hold in one hand in bed.If you update the OS you would lose some features like multiple windows, and some features in S note, etc. So bare this in mind.Honestly I am not a fan of Samsung except their TVs. I found their phones and tablets not worth the hype that much because they are not so good on battery life and they get hot. I find myself still reaching for my iphone to read when I wake up in the middle of the night because it's easier to hold. I am going to invest in a holder/ mount so I can get more use of it.

Reviews.Title: I CAN'T STOP PUTTING THIS DOWN
Reviews.Author: S.Hody
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my tablet - I just wish there were more things for it like cases and such. I don't stop using this thing. The battery lasts for about all day if I'm using it to just write. If I'm playing a game it's like any other device, the battery gets cut. If you're looking for a tablet to use as a notebook and then to browse online or draw. This is the tablet for you. The stylus glides so much smoother on the 8" than the 10". And it's the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: A tablet for productivity
Reviews.Author: H. Takai "chemariachi"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a tablet to take note, make sketches, etc... this is a good option. I like this tablet because of its size, and functionality. It may not have the highest resolution, best sound, and people may not think you're cool, but on the other hand it is very friendly when it comes to taking notes, making annotations, sketches, etc... In other words it is the tablet for work. I chose the 8" because it fits my hands and I can take it everywhere. The S-pen is really good. It recognizes my handwriting well and so far it hasn't disappointed me. I also use to read text, mostly on the internet, and run few apps. One app that does not work is Skype, but it is probably a minor problem compared to all of the rest of apps that do work well. I am pretty happy with this tablet and highly recommend for people who need a gadget for productivity.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for note-taking
Reviews.Author: Yune Young Ji
Reviews.Content: I'm a full time college student and needed a good tablet for note taking as it is such a burden for carrying a big college note for average 4 different subjects per semester. At bought Ipad mini retina and samsung galaxy note 8.0 to compare. The winner goes to Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 hands down! It has built-in note taking app with S-pen which is as accurate as real pen! And a lot of programs didn't work on Ipad mini works well on Galaxy note! I don't even use my macbook any more. I'm so satisfied with galaxy note! :D

Reviews.Title: great all purpose  tablet
Reviews.Author: recruit307
Reviews.Content: I keep this one in my family room and use to when I want instant access to email, internet, photos, etc.  Great camera.  Much better viewing than a smartphone.

Reviews.Title: great product ....questionable delivery
Reviews.Author: Toya Washington
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy with this product. My tablet came a day earlier than expected. For a used tablet it looks extremely new. Came in lovely condition.. the tablet is very easy to use.. being I'm already familiar with Samsung products. If This will be your first tablet there is definitely a learning curve to the tablet. Only thing I didn't like was when it was delivered I never even received an email notification... and I was under the impression that a adult signature was required for delivery. But instead I came home on one of the coldest day of the week atleast -10 degrees outside... with my tablet package sitting outside my side door.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: elexus
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my boyfriend and he loves it. It's great for when he does paperwork for work. I would definitely recommend this product. It even came earlier then expected,  it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves it
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: smooth, fast, and replaces the ipad. does everything and anything. no lagg, awesome cam quality. Plays HD beyond fine. idk what more to say.

Reviews.Title: I couldn't think of a better tablet
Reviews.Author: Denise R.
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a replacement for my nexus 7(1st gen) because it couldn't connect to my tv. I use this for all sorts of things like streaming videos and taking down notes during meetings. I can't imagine my life without it. It has become an essential for me. I have an ipad which i barely use because of this, and I couldn't go back to using the nexus7 because this one is the complete package.

Reviews.Title: Love it: Buy it for the Stylus, the Size, the Ease of Control (though not for the battery life)
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: Quick Background: our household owns/uses the following: older generation Nexus 7, newer generation Nexus 7, this note, and the Sony Xperia (10 inch). Of all the tablets that I've owned, used or looked into, this is my favorite...Also, in case it's useful: I primarily use the tablet for taking notes, sending emails, reading, playing games, and sometimes, watching movies...Pros:1. Love the stylus -- I find it so useful for emails, etc. I've gotten amazingly fast with swype etc and actually get frustrated when I have to actually type-type with my thumbs, on a smart phone!!!2. It's a great size for most of the activities I like -- I use a kindle app for reading (other apps as well sometimes), it's great for watching movies, etc and wonderful for all the little stupid games I'm addicted to.3. It's generally light-weight and travels well4. Takes pictures etc well, though I honestly use that feature very, very rarely as I find it to be an awkard size for that particular function.5. This is a sillier one, but as a mom, I love the photo wall feature that zips through the pictures of my kids I have... (though I'm sure it's part of my battery-life-problem, see below)Cons:1. Mostly just the battery life. I think the battery on both of my Nexus(es) was better. When I've been really gaming, etc. it feels like the batter just drains.2.Though I've had my current one for a few months, the first one I bought actually had to be sent back (its battery drained within the hour) but I had no problems returning it, liked it enough to ask for the replacement (as opposed to just refund) and have loved this one.

Reviews.Title: Love IT
Reviews.Author: Michele A
Reviews.Content: Great tablet.  A little bigger than I expected but great otherwise.  I can carry it around in my purse with out the bulk of other tablets and when I want to use it I take it out and composing, surf the web or paly a game.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab Note 8.0
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "gosumec"
Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet. Lots of free apps from Samsung. Attractive case. Very responsive touch screen. Great colors and resolution. Recommended over apple

Reviews.Title: Absolutely satisfied!!!
Reviews.Author: TEA
Reviews.Content: S-pen - is something incredible! Everything is very convinient! Note works fast, support all modern games without any problems. 8 inch display is comfortable enough to play games, browse Internet, read books and even painting. I am really pleased with Samsung Note.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT FOR NOTETAKING
Reviews.Author: tish dejesus
Reviews.Content: S Note is great for taking notes and keeping memos. Evernote can be used for other purposes such as grocery lists that can be shared between family members. Skype is always available. Fast wi-fi access. I love it!

Reviews.Title: The best Android device Samsung has to offer
Reviews.Author: Bruce E. Reynolds "Excel Expert"
Reviews.Content: I love the quad-core processor. It's much speedier, and I also like the stylus. You can't go wrong getting this Android tablet. It's excellent.

Reviews.Title: seriously great purchase!!!! i definately recommend
Reviews.Author: Ursula
Reviews.Content: i definately recommend and wish bought it before...it is super handy and love using the pen since my fingers hurt from typing

Reviews.Title: what can i say, im very pleased with this tablet
Reviews.Author: TREY RUSHING
Reviews.Content: Now i know why everyone was soldout. Good size and weight with battery life that exceeds what is listed. No regrets on this purchase. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good 8 " tablet.

Reviews.Title: A good Android tablet
Reviews.Author: Thomas F. Olsen "Bellinghamster"
Reviews.Content: I like everything about it except the unsupported Flash Player status. That isn't Samsung's fault, as far as I know, but rather a limitation of Android? Two-day battery life.

Reviews.Title: Early Valentine's Day gift
Reviews.Author: Nikki Weston "Nikki Weston"
Reviews.Content: Being a tech head, it was not hard to find a Valentine's Day gift for my spouse.  He brings this everywhere and said it is convenient to bring this into meetings and take notes instead of lugging around the big Dell Latitude laptop.

Reviews.Title: For Productivity and Fun
Reviews.Author: William Barnes "55_Bill"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my original iPad (iPad 1 - before they numbered them!).  I travel a great deal and wanted something that, like the iPad:1.  Has a good battery life (iPad: 10  -  Galaxy Note:  6)2.  Worked with all my office documents (iPad:  5  -  Galaxy Note (with One Note & Kingsoft Office): 8)3.  Was easy to access and use when crunched for time in an airport (iPad & Galaxy Note: 10)I am VERY pleased with the Galaxy Note 8.  The features I like best are:1.  Android OS - more free apps and overall cost of apps is less; more flexibility in customizing; similar OS as my Moto Razr Maxx2.  Very fast processor3.  great memory.  I have a large number of apps and it NEVER gets bogged down due to too many things running4.  I've added a keyboard and case that helps with productivity5.  Quality and brightness of the screen: exceptional!  Although not OLED, i am very pleased with the screen6.  The touch and feel of the screen are perfect.7.  I don't use the S Pen as much as I thought I would, but is very nice to have when I choose to use it.The size of the Galaxy Note 8 is the most difficult thing for me to get used to.  Not the screen size, per se, but the size and feel of the Note itself.  It is just too big for me to comfortably hold in one hand, but still smaller than the full size iPad i used before.  By this I am not complaining about the screen size, I think the screen size is very good. Rather, it is just a bit awkward feeling but I am getting more used to it.

Reviews.Title: Wow! Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kris D Sparks
Reviews.Content: Had this for a month and it is incredible.  I have been a user and tester of advanced mobility devices since 1999 as part of my job for a fortune 20 company.  Samsung has something special here.  I got the quad core and it is super fast. There are other great reviews of this product, so I will just say seriously consider this product.

Reviews.Title: Love this notebook!
Reviews.Author: ronniemac
Reviews.Content: Great tablet. Love size and convenience and all of its features. Especially like the S-pen. Great way of inputting on the go!

Reviews.Title: Nice electronic tablet
Reviews.Author: Edward Brunell
Reviews.Content: Only have used it for 3 weeks.  It seems to perform well.  Has all the bells and whistles.  Once in a while there will be a slight delay in the response time.  The wife does not use computers or electronics.  On this she quickly learned to email and use the book reader and Netflix movies.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Jesse Devine
Reviews.Content: I like this better than the ipad mini and I use the stylus pen all the time even though I never thought I would.  My only complaint thus far is the battery life is a little low, but not awful.

Reviews.Title: Love but Beware
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "txspurgin"
Reviews.Content: There was little doubt that I was going with the Samsung Note, but which size? I am thrilled so far (been a few days) that I chose the 8.0 ( GT-N511). So much nicer than my ancient 10 inch Acer. The aNote and WatchOn apps are brillant. The clarity of the screen (using a clear HD screen protector) is amazing. I still have much more fun ahead. You will need some time adjusting to holding this tablet, like any hand held device. My thumbs are occassionally hitting the back button (bottom right of home button).Beware that you probably DO NOT want to upgrade the OS to 4.2.2. The original came with 4.1.2, but when I upgrade to 4.2.2, the awesome Smart Dock turned dunce. Samsung Customer Service said that the Smart Dock isn't compatible, but there are videos of people having success with the Note 8.0 and Smart Dock...they were using Android 4.1.2 though! And there is no way to downgrade unless you Root/Flash the device (which voids the warranty). So buyer beware.So if you don't care about the Smart Dock incompatibility, then this is your tablet!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Terri Stalons
Reviews.Content: We shopped at best buy and couldn't get anyone to wait on us. So I pulled out my phone and looked this product up on amazon and was surprised to see exactly what I wanted and $50 less than best buy. It was a Christmas gift for our daughter and she loves it! It will be a big help to her as she returns to college in a few days. I would recommend it to everyone who wants a note or tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet! +what would make it better
Reviews.Author: A. Lee
Reviews.Content: I've been using this tablet for over 6 months now and still absolutely love it.  In my mind this is the *only* mid-size tablet that gets pen input right, which is unique.  The digitizer based screen is a HUGE benefit and makes note taking or sketching very pleasant.  I use this every day for taking notes and it actually works -- fast and accurate.  AND one of the least-often touted advantages of the digitizer is the fact you can *hover* buttons in a browser, so pull-downs and other menus are actually usable.  No other tablet -- iPad or otherwise -- can do that.I have also looked at tablet PCs from Microsoft, Sony, etc but keep coming back to the Galaxy Notes as the best option for portability, features, app selection, and price.  Even now after the release of Nexus 7 and iPad mini retina I still think this is the best tablet for artists or note takers.  If you just need a tablet for touch, I agree with other reviewers that you can get a better bang for the buck with a Nexus 7 or non digitizer-based tablet.Of course, no product is perfect so here are some things I would want in the next version:- Higher res screen, 1080p or better- Bigger stylus with more weight (I bought a separate Samsung stylus, don't use the original)- Better battery life -- I get about 1 day with heavy use, 2 days with light use, 2.5 days at standby.  Would prefer 3-4 days of juice.- Better case/cover options -- the official Samsung case is flimsy and others are not as high quality as iPad equivalents

Reviews.Title: love this tablet....
Reviews.Author: D. Davis
Reviews.Content: I've been using an ipad for years, this is my first droid device and I am very happy!  I love the stylus and being able to take notes with it, that was the main reason I chose the note 8.0

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Note 8.0
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Puangchinda
Reviews.Content: This was a reconditioned unit. It set up easily, lots of updates initially. One of them caused an issue (the only reason for the 4 instead of 5 rating), but I reset it and its been great ever since. Its light and very easy to use. I love the S Pen feature.

Reviews.Title: really nice but could use a few improvements.
Reviews.Author: E Dub
Reviews.Content: Resolution could be slightly crisper but still really sharp.Camera hump on the back is annoying especially since the back camera isn't that good.Other than that it's a really nice responsive tablet and the pressure sensitive pen is great for drawing.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Mister Dodo
Reviews.Content: Does freaking everything. S Pen helps with jotting down notes and integration with Google Drive allows me to access all my school assignments..

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung Galaxy to replace my typical notebooks and it really does help me. I carry it everyday and is reliable with a good processor. I would say that the 16GB is not enough so I bough an extra 64GB SSD to have all data, music and videos with me.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Ted L. Norrid
Reviews.Content: I love being able to take hand written notes and storing them in folders.  It is a great all around tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love at first sight
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I am amazed at what it can do. A lot of it has been intutive and the rest I am learning from the downloaded manua. The picture is awesome and everyday I learn something new about it. Highly recommend.l

Reviews.Title: aweson
Reviews.Author: Devon white
Reviews.Content: Just got my hands on this tablet for 359.99 great deal I own a ipad and this tablet is far superior I love it I love the s pen, without the spen it would be just an ordinary tablet with the s pen its a uniquely designed and truely great

Reviews.Title: Very good personal tablet
Reviews.Author: big nick
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying it at first.  Ive had it a month and use it alot ofr meetings and surveying.  its very handy and does everything flawlessly.  The pen is accurate.  i really have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product
Reviews.Author: Luciano
Reviews.Content: It works great, the S pen is exactly what you expect and you need. The full HD screen leaves nothing to imagination. The fact that you can expand your memory card for very little money makes it an even better deal

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: F. G. Nunes "FGNunes"
Reviews.Content: Thought of a tablet, but I'd like to skip the 10"ones given the size and weight. This Samsung seems to be the best solution for my search. Nice design, light and comfortable it a great "on the go" tool. Nice, fast response amazing, crispy screen definition and colors and the S pen are among ots great features. The only problem is the about 10Gb free memory for a 16Gb capacity, what means only 60% of available room. This is litttle for a machine like this.

Reviews.Title: This is a really lovely tablet.
Reviews.Author: Sarra Lederman
Reviews.Content: I love my new tablet.  It is so easy to use, and stays charged for a long time.  It is so perfect in size and lightweight.  I am still getting used to using it.... but as a book reader it is the best I've seen.  Really good product.  Looks just like and I Pad, but is actually better, price wise, you can't compete, and  because I  love all the apps,  I can sync it by blue tooth to my cell phone and get wifi anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Really like it, but had screen hardware issues.
Reviews.Author: W. Wetherbee "Trek biker"
Reviews.Content: I would give the Galaxy Note 8 five stars except that I had hardware issues with the screen.  The Note is fast and has a vivid screen.  I got the wifi version only and upgrading it was very easy.  Several goodies came with the Samsung Note registration, like $25 to use at the Play Store and $50 to use at Samsung WatchOn.  If I had known this, I would not have agonized nearly as much about spending the money for this tablet.The only downside was that the screen started to fail after a week and showed colored blocks.  I thought the upgrade or some app was the culprit.  Samsung support was good and after trying a few things, I ended up resetting the Note back to factory settings.  This seemed to work for a few days and then the issues started again.  I worked with Samsung support and saw that pressing the screen was now making it change colors.  Now I knew this was a hardware issue.  Support sent me a link to print the label and shipping was free.  It took less than a week to get the Note fixed and returned (fortunately I live close to a service center).  The Note has worked great since.  One other downside was that I added a 64GB micro SD card and forgot to remove it before sending it in.  The card was not supposed to be touched but it was removed and not returned.  I called Samsung and they promised to send an AMEX gift certificate that will basically cover the cost of the SD card.  The AMEX gift cheque arrived today.

Reviews.Title: my son love it!
Reviews.Author: 7300gilbert
Reviews.Content: now he barely look into his laptop anymore ...it's very good for university student to take any notes and even recording.love it!

Reviews.Title: tablet and then some
Reviews.Author: GrDnMM
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC! I love it. Very handy. Big enough to type or write but not too big. very portable, color screen is outa sight!

Reviews.Title: Best 8 inch tablet on the market
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Really love my note 8. I have an ipad and wanted something smaller and more portable.  I have got my faith back in android and am probably going to switch back. I got really bored with ios and love the customization and the spen. I am going to get a note 3 or s4 because of this product

Reviews.Title: Loveeeeeeee
Reviews.Author: Shilohna
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research into the best tablet for me I was determined that this would meet my needs and it soooo has! I have been approached by numerous persons asking which tablet it is. The 1 inch difference from the tab 2 makes such a huge difference! I love it!

Reviews.Title: Definite Potential!
Reviews.Author: Old Teck
Reviews.Content: First off, I have owned a galaxy note 10.1 since first release, I wished they would have put the parts of 10.1 into the 8's body! Even though 8 has bigger processor and memory it has noticeable lag issue's up to the 10.1! There's no tablet out there going to top the 10.1, not even samsung's predecessor in what they first said was going to be a 8 inch version of there 10.1 with stronger processors and better battery, they fell short on both categories! Don't get me wrong it's not quite going back to the store just yet, love the form factor up to the 10.1! I personally think that samsung put harsh processor restrictions on this unit! Photo shop touch is not here unlike on the 10.1 and video editor isn't either,  video editor is available via samsung's app store (free) and photo shop touch through play store for a very high 9.99! This 8" of mine will most definitely be getting rooted just to unlock full potential of hardware and to eliminate all samsung's pre loaded push software!

Reviews.Title: Very solid tablet
Reviews.Author: Jack Arnold
Reviews.Content: My older tablet is a Motorola Xoom (wifi only). I bought the Note 8.0 as a replacement and I desired the pen functionality.  1 week with the unit has proven that I made the right choice. The price is worth it for the features and the quality.

Reviews.Title: Small tablet, powerful features
Reviews.Author: RWL
Reviews.Content: Still playing with this tablet, but it has lots of features, and is really comfortable in your hand, and is easy to setup for email, and other applications. I added the 64 GB sandisk memory card, which helps extend the storage capacity. The tablet takes great photos and videos, and is way cheaper than the mini Ipad.

Reviews.Title: Google+ discussion group for penabled devices
Reviews.Author: I. Thomas
Reviews.Content: If folks would like to discuss anything related to your Note8.0 or any other tablet with a stylus, you are welcome at the G+ "Tablet Pens and Sins" group. See you there! - Ivor

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: PBin "PMB"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my daughter who is in college.  She wanted it to help take notes in class and the other apps (she has an ipad) but likes android better.  She can also chat with this and use it as a remote for the TV.  I thought it was a little expensive but she likes it and uses it all the time.

Reviews.Title: own it!
Reviews.Author: Mateusz
Reviews.Content: Its been a hard choice, i always would like to posses tablet which will be great use for me. The 7 inch do not do for me and almoust all 8 inch wasnt equiped with good hardware, then note 8 come. Meybe price is a lite too high, but surley this tab is worth it.

Reviews.Title: I Love It
Reviews.Author: A. Mordo
Reviews.Content: Pros:This is an excellent product. The Galaxy Not 8 is smooth and works fast, very easy to hold. Compare with my other tablets (iPad and Motorola Xoom) it is much better, I think it is the perfect size, the screen is big enough and the device is small enough to hold in one hand. Other 7" devices were slightly too small for for my taste, but this 8" screen is perfect.Con:There is an issue with connecting to wifi under certain network configuration. The Note 8 will not "see" some wireless networks. After some trial and errors I manage to solve this issue by changing my wifi router settings (you can read about the problem and the solution here: [...] ).The S-Pen is a nice feature, but since I use evernote which does not support S-Pen there is not much use for it (for me), unless you use Samsung's S-Note. This is not really a con for the Note 8 but more a con for evernote.Overall I highly recommend this product

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Note 8.0 - Just Right!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If I could I would give this tablet a rating  of 4.5 stars. It's not perfect  because I often accidentally press the power and return buttons. That's very annoying when it happens while I'm watching Netflix, HBO Go or when I'm reading a book. I'm using the Moko Ultra Slim Lightweight case  for protection but it has the power and volume buttons fully exposed. Other cases may solve my problem, but I haven't looked into it yet. The GN8.0 is also very expensive but it has the features that I want in a tablet. While I was willing to pay extra, I still wish that its price is lower.I wanted it for its size, good screen resolution, IR controller, and the S-pen. Like many of the reviewers here, I own multiple devices. I  have  the iPad, HP Touchpad, iPhone and the Samsung S3 but lately, I  tend to use the GN8.0 more frequently. The S-pen, with the Google keyboard, is very convenient for taking notes. I also like it when I can  easily switch to sketching with a precise pen.The remote control feature is also nice to have. I can control the home theater in the family room, the master bedroom TV and the TV in my sister's house.  It works with the Panasonic, Samsung and Sony TVs that I have tried to control. I don't know if there is a  limit to the number of devices I can configure. I will find out when  have visited my siblings and friends. Bottom line, I'm happy with this purchase. It meets my needs just right.

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing
Reviews.Author: Kicou
Reviews.Content: I love my note 8. For someone who is always carrying a note book and taking note this device is a must. The size is perfect and fits in my purse, its light weight and very easy to use.The best part to me is the stylus pen. If im on a website and I only need one paragraph I simply circle it and transfer it to the note pad.When ideas come, I voice note it or I write it on the memo pad which comes up as soon as you take out the pen.The multiple screen is a another great feature.  Works great when watching a video and taking notes. Or writing an email while on a website.My note is with me 24/7 :-)

Reviews.Content: Coming from owning the Galaxy Note II,  which I love, I was looking forward to getting the 8". I also had a $25 reward to use in Play Store.The problems are that there is only one color available (white), but this is not important taking into account that the white color is pretty cool, and the camera does not have flash, so night photos are poor.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS TABLET!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted something ultra-portable that I could use for "everything" -- reading, games, writing, email, web-surfing, etc. I compared features and prices of all the reasonably priced tables, and narrowed my choices down to the Google Nexus 7, and the Samsung Note 8. After some research, I decided that the Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 was exactly what I was looking for -- the right size, the right features, the right everything. At $399, it was more expensive than the other possibilities, but I am so happy that I didn't allow this purchase to be driven by price. I especially like the built in S-pen feature, but the screen also responds very well to a regular stylus. I use my tablet every day and have never been happier with a tech purchase!

Reviews.Title: It works for me!
Reviews.Author: c joy "book lover/ dual android/apple user"
Reviews.Content: I was on the fence about this device but the in depth reviews on amazon convinced me to give it a try. I have owned the galaxy note 8 for over a month and can find no major fault with it. I was consdering the ipad mini 2 but since I own a galaxy s2  and other samsung tablets I went with Samsung instead. Reviews.Content: I started with the Galaxy Note 10.1 but found it too heavy and too big for regular use.While the screen capabilities made the Galaxy Note 8 an attractive device (love the handwriting recognition and accessories) the fact that the battery wouldn't last more than 2-3 hours with mild use has caused me to switch to an ipad mini.The size and weight are great but the battery made this impossible to keep.

Reviews.Author: Jambo 86 "ejbm"
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurbished Note 8.0 about 8-months ago. I use it everyday. Under heavy use the battery lasts at least two days before getting down to around 30%. But I find myself using the Note more. I like the size, the sPen and the fact that I added a 128GB microSD chip which is really great, holds tons of books, video and audio.

Reviews.Title: First tablet, love it!
Reviews.Author: Geronimo
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet primarily for school note taking. I can honestly say it was one of the best academic decisions I have made, it not only spares me of the hassle of bringing paper and writing utensils but also saves me time (I can just take it out of my backpack, take notes, and put it back in). The S pen is absolutely amazing! And when I want to relax this tablet is great for just about anything, music, movies, games, web browsing. Greatest decision and will probably integrate the use of this tablet for the rest of my college note taking.

Reviews.Title: Lived up to expectations
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I did the appropriate research you do when making a big purchase. The coolest thing is the wifi direct where i can stream a video to my smart tv from the tablet. Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Larissa
Reviews.Content: I love the Note 8.0.  It has the perfect screen size, the S pen is great to take notes with or write journal entries in my own handwriting.  It is a nice complement with my Note 2 phone.  I just wish Samsung didn't take forever to roll out their updates for Android and I do not like the Touchwiz screen.  I use a different launcher program.  I can link my info from my phone to my tablet with ease.  I have used several tablets, including the new iPad Mini with Retina display.  I like and prefer the customizable platform that Android offers and there are so many free apps available.  Basically any app that is available to for iOS is available for Android. This stylus actually works to write with,versus the typical stylus that does not allow for very accurate note taking.

Reviews.Title: So Far so Awesome
Reviews.Author: Ariela Q. "Aris"
Reviews.Content: I bought this little thing and I'm pleased.I love working with Sketchbook Pro. Battery is long lasting and it's pretty fast working.Awesome tablet, I wouldn't change it.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet, great price, effective handwriting recognition
Reviews.Author: R. Mason
Reviews.Content: Pros:  - The pen  - The Screen  - Solid tablet in all other respectsCons:  - Slippery glossy back  - A bit big  - Price (but as a refurb, the price issue went away)Being older (though quite technical), I really never fully made the jump from handwriting to thumb typing. Having the ability to write my notes is much more intuitive to me that to hunt and peck at an on screen keyboard.  But, all the capacitive stylus hardware and software I have tried is crude and inaccurate. Basically a waste of time.  So I thought I'd give the Galaxy Note a try.  I have always wondered why, if Palm could make it work (albeit with a shorthand language) 15 years ago, why couldn't someone make it work really well today, given the advances in software and processing power.  Well, Samsung seems to have done just that.  So while in other respects this tablet is really not noticeably different than other 7/8 inch tablets, for me, the pen really makes a difference.So why only 4 starts?  First, I reserve 5 for near perfect only, and this is great, but has a couple issues:  1) the smooth glossy back. It may look pretty, but it doesn't give much grip. I prefer my (now given away) Nexus 7 in that regard.  2) the size - while 8 inch does give noticeably more screen size, it goes from being easily hand held, to marginal - really a bit big for long term holding.  I don't have huge hands, but their not tiny either - probably average to slightly large for men. I could see this bordering on being a two hand device for women.  Again, I prefer the 7" nexus in this regard.But in the end, the pen makes the difference. And as I bought this as a refurbished unit, at a deep discount - total price close to new "normal" tablets, I am quite happy.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0
Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: I purchased Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 (white) about 6 months ago, and so far,  I have never had any problems with this tablet.  I like how thin it is and that it is faster than Galaxy Tab series.  But I do wish that its screen had a better resolution.  Although I can read small texts, they are not clear enough to read Web pages,  at least for me.

Reviews.Title: A spectacular tablet and you can get very cheap
Reviews.Author: Cliente Kindle
Reviews.Content: The 8 inch size is great for reading and working. Not as small as a 7-inch, but not as big as one of 10. Buy this tablet primarily to read and paint. Reading is quite good, and the pen works great. The tablet is very powerful with quad-core processor and 2GB of RAM. The display has a maximum brightness level of amazing, and is very colorful. It is not Full HD, but it looks pretty good, and I really like.The camera did not expect much, it's bad. But the camera is what I care less on a tablet. For me it is something useless.Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 (16GB, White)This screen is 1280 x 720 pixels. Not as sharp as the latest Galaxy Tab 8.4 , Kindle Nexus 10 or HDX , but very colorful screen and looks pretty good.Something I really liked is reading ebooks. Also I have a Kindle Fire HDX 7, which is great for reading, but the Galaxy Note 8 so is. Being the brightest screen, thought it would be annoying to read , but to test it , I have been amazed at how good it is to read , I'm not tired eyes and I can read the text very well .Taking notes freely in the S -Note has also been a very pleasant experince , I can create as many pages as you like and keep everything in folders.Sketchbook Pro also runs very well , this tablet has a quad -core 1.6GHZ processor , 2GB RAM. Reviews.Content: This is a very good tablet.  It has some small issues (the android update caused some problems with the split screen) but overall its great.  After some minor inconveniences (with update) everything works great (even the split screen again).Processor, battery life, display, and S-Pen function are all very good.
